items.title: [sql] add sql plugin
items.body:
<!--
  Keep PR title verbose enough and add prefix telling about what plugin it touches e.g "[prometheus]" or "[core]" when it touches other parts of the app.

  If you add a breaking change within your PR you should add ":warning:" to the title, e.g. ":warning: [core] My breaking change"
-->

<!--
  Description of what have been changed. Please also reference an issue, when available.
-->

**Changes:**

- added completion for sql syntax
- added completion for `<table>.<column>` and `<table>` in query text field
- migrated UI to mui
- added bigquery support

  Place an '[x]' (no spaces) in all applicable fields.

items.title: [klogs] Fix Add Filter for Number Fields

labels.name: changelog: fixed
labels.description: Something which wasn't working is fixed

items.body:
When a user used the add filter buttons from the table view of an document to search for a value or to exclude a value this was only working for fields of type string, because we didn't know the type of a field in the React app.

This is now fixed, by returning an array of objects from our API with each field as "name" property and the field type as "type" property. This information is then used in the React app to adjust the filter which should be added based on the type of the field.

items.title: [mongodb] Fix History for Pipeline and Update

labels.name: changelog: fixed
labels.description: Something which wasn't working is fixed

items.body:
The history of the pipeline and update fields were not saved, this is now fixed by saving the current entry of the pipeline and update field when a query is executed by the user.

items.title: [klogs] Add Query History
items.body:
The queries which a user executes are now saved in the local storage with the "kobs-klogs-queryhistory" key. This allows a user to quickly select queries which he already executed again. The history can be accessed via the adornment in the query editor.

items.title: [klogs] Adjust Components Structure
items.body:
- Adjust the structure of the React components to be similar to the other plugins
- Adjust error messages to be similar to the other plugins
- Fix some bugs, e.g. the query was not adjusted when the time range was adjusted
- Adjust aggregation page, to have all options in the toolbar, similar to the MongoDB plugin

items.title: [core] Ensure same Height for all Plugin Panels

labels.name: changelog: fixed
labels.description: Something which wasn't working is fixed

items.body:
This commit ensures that all panels shown on the plugins page are having the same height, for this we are always display three lines of the description. The title and cluster / type is capped to 1 line.

items.title: [core] Fix Returned Error Type from useQuery Hook

labels.name: changelog: fixed
labels.description: Something which wasn't working is fixed

items.body:
Our useQuery hook always returns an "APIError", but in some places we were still using "Error". These occurences are now replaces with the correct error type.

items.title: [techdocs] Fix Vertical Scrolling in Service Pages

labels.name: changelog: fixed
labels.description: Something which wasn't working is fixed

items.body:
When a code block contained very long lines it could happen that a user must scroll vertically on a service page. This is now fixed by wrapping long lines in a code block.

Because of this new setting copying content from a code block adds some useless newlines, so that we added a copy button to each code block to make it easier for users to copy the content.

items.title: [mongodb] Fix Overflow in Documents View

labels.name: changelog: fixed
labels.description: Something which wasn't working is fixed

items.body:
It could happen that the table layout breaks in some case causing a vertical scroll in the documents view. This is now fixed by breaking all words.

The table cells are now also not vertically aligned at the top, because this doesn't look that good, so that they are now vertically aligned in the middle.

items.title: [core] Fix Links in Application Groups Panel

labels.name: changelog: fixed
labels.description: Something which wasn't working is fixed

items.body:
The "Environment" button overflowed the description of an application in some cases. To fix this the button is replaced with an icon button with the apps icon, which can be used to view an shown application for the different environments.
